SENT.plain: We present three patients with hematological malignancies, all neutropenic and febrile despite broadspectrum antibiotics
They all developed a sparse rash with purpuric maculopapules with a violaceous hue centrally
These skin lesions were associated with systemic Candida infections and responded well to antifungal treatment
They appeared to be a short-cut to the diagnosis of systemic Candida infections for both the hematologist and the dermatologist
